name: The Westin Boston Waterfront

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights in November and two of those nights between 4am and 5am the fire alarm for the building went off. The alarm, a flashing strobe light, whooping noise, and a recorded bored woman’s voice alerting you that an alarm has been triggered and to stay in your room, is effective, but copasetic to sleep, it certainly is not. The alarm flashed, and boomed for 10 minutes, before a tired man’s voice came into our room, said that something happened in the kitchen and that’s about it.
reviews.title: The bed is comfy….

likes.disliked: — The alarm, crowds, and diry hallways.

reviews.text: I suppose in a way it was exciting.
reviews.title: Not Close to Anything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had never been in a hotel when a fire alarm had gone off.
reviews.title: It's a bit of a walk, but I liked it.

likes.liked: — Although the location is not the best, I rated it above average because we were there on July 4th and it rained but we were able to get a great view of the fireworks from our room.
likes.disliked: — The proximity to the rest of Boston is not the best, but it is really close to the airport.

reviews.title: Corporate Travel Agent Point of View
reviews.text: Going off at 4am, wasn’t too pleasing though.
It happening again the next morning at 5am was even less pleasing.
reviews.title: Off the beaten track but nice
Good Hotel - Don't Be Afraid Of Location!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Westin Boston Waterfront last year and it was great. I've read lots of complaints about location and I don't quite understand them.

There is a "T" station right across the street from the hotel (literally a five minute walk out the front door). Using the T, you can be at the airport in about 10 minutes (for less than 5 dollars for 2 people). Or, you can be downtown at restaurants and other attractions in about 10 minutes as well. No need for expensive taxis or rental cars. If you're up for a bit of a walk, you can be in downtown in 20-25 minutes.
reviews.title: Really great views

reviews.text: The hotel itself was great too. Comfortable beds, soundproof windows, and we paid just over $100/night.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, Superb service

reviews.text: Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Better than expected

likes.liked: — The lifts were very fast and the good bar food
likes.disliked: — Small wardrobe in rooms and expensive internet access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I only stayed 1 night I found the hotel to be very pleasant. The decor is updated and pretty, the service was just fine. The young lady at the outdated business center even let me use her computer to download a file. The food was good too. The best part was the view from my corner room. I could have looked out onto the harbor for much longer but I had to catch a flight. If you need to be in this area, don't hesitate to book.
reviews.title: Excellent Product - Know the location and it's a plus not a minus

likes.liked: — New and clean, great rooms, SPG is impossible to beat
likes.disliked: — Limited F&B options over the weekend, no free internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night at this hotel as we flying into Boston and then heading out the next morning. It was fine for that. I would not stay here for a vacation to Boston, however, as the location is fairly remote and there is not much there except the attached convention center. The whole area is under construction with new buildings and you could be anywhere - no feeling of being in Boston. If you are attending a convention it would be fine. The hotel is fairly new, clean, pleasant enough. It was quiet. Staff was fine.
reviews.title: A Business Hotel

likes.disliked: — could have been in any city

reviews.text: It feels like a scaled down Westin, though. Not as nice as some other properties in the same chain. The lobby bar is nice and has a decent wine selection. Oh, and the parking is very expensive.
reviews.title: Location not great but nice hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed in many Westin's around the world and this one provided no surprises. As you can see from many of the reviews, this is primarily a conference hotel and is located adjacent to the new Boston exhibition centre. This does have the advantage of only being about 8 minutes drive from Logan which is great if you have an early morning flight or arrive late.
reviews.title: Maid stole from my wallet

reviews.text: I had booked single night stays at either end of the week and received my requested room on the first stay and was upgraded to a suite on the second (due to my Starwood status). Both rooms were clean, fairly new and everything you would expect from a Westin. The Westin Heavenly bed always ensures I get a great nights sleep and this hotel also had flat screen LCD TV's with HD pictures which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Hotel is not organized!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had a great bar but I spent most of my time with friends in the back bay area of Boston ($12 cab ride away). Service at check-in and check-out was courteous and quick.
reviews.title: Loved sipping cocktails in the lounge after a day of sight-seeing

likes.disliked: — rude waiter at Sauciety (I feel cheesy typing that name!)

reviews.text: Great hotel if you are going to the convention center or arriving by Train at South Street Station. Also about 1 mile walk to financial district which I would not recommend in bad weather. Over-all this hotel is clean, new, and well run. Breakfast is very over-priced so try to get a room rate which includes breakfast. I also got a better rate booking directly with starwood versus the rate the hotel quoted me. This place gets noisy when a large convention is in town as the convention center is literally across the street.
reviews.title: New and Clean but caters to conference goers.

reviews.text: First off I was traveling for business and was lucky to have my mother and 4 year old daugher join me. I was away for almost a week, so was glad to have them along.
reviews.title: Good place to stay if you have business in the area

reviews.text: Check in was a breeze even though the lobby was buzzing with conventioners. The woman that checked us in wheeled out a Radio Flyer filled with toys and let my daughter pick what she wanted! Very nice touch indeed. Very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: What you would expect from a Westin.

reviews.text: Despite what others have said about the concierge service here we never encountered anything but helpful staff, very friendly and willing to give directions, whatever. When we called down for the "trolley tour" they informed us that there was a magician on Saturday morning for the kids, very nice touch. They always said hello to us when we passed by.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel

reviews.text: My daughter used the pool as well and had a blast. Although we didn't use it, the gym looked awesome. The restaurant food was pretty good, good wine by the glass selection.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for One Night Stay for Two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here at the end of our tour of New England for one night as it was close to the airport. We found it easily, parked in the self parking (approx $27) and were quickly checked in to a room on the thirteenth floor. We explored the restaurants and went for a swim before heading down to the bar to chill inffont of the TV showing the game. The concierge was excellent when asked how to spend the evening yet not go to a restaurant - one of the harder questions to answer i thought. The whole hotel was fine, probably set up more for the business traveller then leisure but everyone was extremely helpful and polite.
reviews.title: Great for the night

reviews.text: The next morning we loaded the car up and left it there before walking to Downtown crossing which wasn't really that far at all and then we wandered across Boston all the way to Copley Place and back. The Transit is just across the way from the hotel but we were in the mood to mooch before our long flight home, so I would have to disagree with those people who complain about the hotel being far from anywhere , I would say it was about a mile from Downtown crossing. A very pleasant stay. My only complaint about the hotel was that out of the nine hotels we stayed in (ranging from inns to enormous hotels) this was the only one with a charge for internet connection in the room and it wasn't wireless so useless for my i-touch.
reviews.title: Comfortable room, great staff, noisy hallways.

reviews.text: The hotel is very nice, Rooms very clean and the beds are VERY comfortable. The staff is great and there is plenty of staff to help you with anything you need. Great at giving directions, providing restaurant suggestions, maps, getting taxis arranged, etc. The lobby is large and very loud. One complaint many from my group had was we all experienced hallways noises that woke us up in the night. Door slamming from several doors away sounded like they were right in your room, must be some strange design "flaw". I would suggest bringing ear plugs, as I had the fan running on the ventilation system but that was not enough to buffer the hallway noises. This hotel is right next to a convention center, so there were many groups and "conventioneers", so the activity level in the hotel was very high during the first week of May. Public transportation is right across the street and walking into the city takes only about 15 minutes. Rooms do not really have that much of a view, it is not right on the water as you might think.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near Convention Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in March 2009 for a special event. This is a fairly new hotel near the convention center. Overall this hotel is very nice. Rooms are spacious and the Westin beds are extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Left a bad taste in my mouth...

reviews.text: The Irish restaurant at the hotel is reasonably priced. Lobby restaurant features a good, but expensive breakfast buffet. The lobby itself is modern and large.
reviews.title: Great Hotel With Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: I have no complaints at all about the Westin for the 4 nights I stayed here for a conference.
reviews.title: No complaints

reviews.text: The service is excellent, the rooms are spacious, clean and well decorated. Their staff were extremely friendly and very helpful; I was very surprised to read negative reviews.
reviews.title: bad service/prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location isn't perfect, we needed a taxi to get to main sites but the conference I attended was at the Westin so this was the reason for staying here.
reviews.title: A comfortable stay

likes.disliked: — The checkout. The guy was new and it took 20 minutes.

reviews.text: They have great conference facitilies, a Starbucks and very good restaurants.
reviews.title: You’ll Be Fine

reviews.text: I stayed at the Westin Waterfront for 5 nights for a conference. Charges for internet and food were all fairly steep (see below), but expected. What was not expected was the rude behavior of the staff. Perhaps a 20-something doesn't command the type of respect that the usual business class does, but wow. My room-mate was arriving into Boston before I was, yet I was not allowed to add his name to the room and so had to check in before he could access the room. Seriously?
reviews.title: Stay at Copley Place instead

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Waterfront for three nights in August. We had a very nice comfortable room at the end of the hallway. I can't complain about anything, it was kept very clean, and had the most comfortable beds. It is within walking distance to downtown, for me a little far for the hubby. The lobby is very pleasant and the staff was helpful. The only negitive was the parking cost but I guess that is a negitive in any big city.
reviews.title: Good Deal

likes.liked: — kept very clean and the heavenly beds

reviews.text: I was "trapped" in this hotel for a week attending a conference. This hotel has one "plus"...it is attached to the Boston Convention Center. Everything else about this hotel is definitely a "minus." First of all there is nothing near this hotel...no restaurants, no bars and little of the cultural offerings of Boston. The "T" is a short distance away but there are no travelers' amenities within a reasonable walk of this hotel. My experience was one of inconsistent service, indifferent staff and inaccessible managment. You cannot access the management of this hotel...it is as if the management does not exist. Avoid this hotel unless you have no other options.
reviews.title: Worst Westin Ever Visited

reviews.text: Called ahead saturday afternoon and was qoted rate of $269 but when we arrived at hotel, check in staff said it was $309 but then grudgingly dropped to $299. After check in, Staff refused to send a rollaway bed for our son quoting fire regulations, even though they knew we had two teenagers in a room with only two queen beds, so he had to sleep on floor. When challenged later, staff could not provide documentation for said fire regulations. Parking at $39 is a rip off as free overnight street parking is plentiful locally.
reviews.title: Not worth high prices, poor service

reviews.text: Swimming pool was small yet full of rowdy adults throwing around large beach balls apparently provided by Westin?? So effectively the pool was made useless for a family. Trolley tours sold in the hotel are at least $10 more than other operators and harbour tours are $7 extra while others include them for free.
reviews.title: good experience

likes.disliked: — Location is off the beaten track but you can quickly walk to the center of town

reviews.title: Great people!!
reviews.text: General opinion was a feeling of being gouged for very poor service in a so so hotel. Unless you are on a business expense account signed by a generous manager it's best to avoid this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got a fantastic deal on this hotel from otel.com (It was a secret hotel, that I managed to work out, that cost £290 for 5 nights!), but was quite unsure if to book it due to the reviews I had read, but I am glad that I did.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though this hotel is out of the city centre I must admit that it did not cause any inconvenience to our stay. The transport links in Boston are fantastic and with the T stop being just over the road it was so easy to get to any area in a few minutes. Cabs were also rather cheap, it only cost us $5 - $8 to get from Copley and Downtown back to the hotel. We have stayed in central Boston previously and I must say that staying by the Waterfront was no problem at all, if anything it was rather relaxing as there were no busy street sounds when trying to sleep. There is also a plentiful supply of cabs outside the hotel and the Boston tour bus comes to the hotel reception.
reviews.title: Ring in the NEw Year!

reviews.text: In all the hotel was very nice. The room was large, clean and very comfortable. We also found the staff very nice and friendly, check in was quick and easy and check out was made even better as they allowed us to delay check out until 5pm! We also found Teresa on the service desk very helpful, she managed to put us in touch with a really cheap and convenient way to get out to the Outlet Village and provided us with take away menus when we wanted a night in after all the shopping we had done in the day had worn us out.
reviews.title: Great hotel, beware of location and service could improve

likes.liked: — Nice modern lobby and room. Very confortable beds.

reviews.title: Great Convention hotel!
reviews.text: I live in Boston but wanted to have a special New Year's Eve with my boyfriend. I booked last minute for a harbor view room. The view of the firework's from my room located on the 5th floor was spectacular. I was worried about the noise considering the hotel was having a ball but the walls are thick enough that I never heard anyone in the next room or in the hallway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had all the amenities needed and the bed was super comfy.
reviews.title: perfect !

description: The Westin Boston Waterfront Hotel is located in in the waterfront area of this historic city. We offer convenient access to the Airport with plenty of meeting space.
